items.title: Alkem vs Allchem: Pharma players in a legal tussle over who owns the name
items.description: Pharma major Alkem Labs has filed a case against IPO-bound, Vadodara-based Allchem Lifesciences in the Delhi High Court, seeking damages and injunction on the use of the trademark. The matter will now be heard on July 9 with both parties directed to go through mediation.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on June 13
items.description: On June 13, Sensex dropped over 573 points (0.70 percent) to close at 81,118.60. Nifty 50, meanwhile, fell nearly 170 points (0.68 percent) to end the session at 24,718.60

items.title: European airline shares slide on Israel-Iran tensions: Lufthansa, Air France KLM, Airbus shares plunge up to 4%
items.description: European airline stocks are accompanying their Indian aviation peers, with IndiGo and SpiceJet shares being down up to 4%

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty off lows but below 24,750, Sensex down 0.7% on Iran-Israel jitters
items.description: Except media, all other sectoral indices ended in the red with FMCG, PSU Bank, oil & gas, power, telecom down 0.5-1 percent. The broader indices outperformed the main indices with the BSE midcap and smallcap indices falling 0.3 percent each.

items.title: Live: Sensex, Nifty sink over 1% each this week amid rising geopolitical tensions | Closing Bell
items.description: Middle East Tensions Spark Selloff. Iran Fires 100 Drones In Retaliation. Iran Confirms Damage At Nataz Nuclear Site. Oil Prices Cool Off From Highs At $74/bbl. Sensex Off Day's Lows, Down Over 550 Pts. Nifty Slips Below 24,750. It, Realty Stocks Buck Weak Mkt Trend. Volatility Eases From Highs, India Vix Up 7(%). Midcap, Smallcap Indices In Negative Territory. Nifty 50 Gainers: Bel, Ongc, Tech Mahindra. Nifty 50 Losers: Adani Ports, Sbi, Itc. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: Nazara Tech shares surge 7% after 15.42 lakh shares change hands in Rs 190-crore block deal
items.description: Nazara Tech share price: This comes days after veteran investor Rekha Jhunjhunwala sold nearly 2 percent stake in the gaming company for Rs 218 crore.

items.title: Sensex falls 570 pts, Nifty below 24,750 as Middle East tensions keep investors on edge
items.description: India VIX, the barometer to assess market anxiety, surged 7.56 percent to 15.08, signalling heightened market volatility.

items.title: Equity Strategy: How to navigate choppy markets in the face of escalating Middle East tensions
items.description: Israel-Iran tensions have sent crude soaring, hitting a number of linked sectors. The bigger worry is at the macro level. Does a falling market present a buying opportunity?

items.title: Mutual funds go bargain hunting in May, buy Rs 29,000 crore of shares from exiting promoters, FIIs
items.description: Mutual funds emerged as dominant buyers in May, investing over Rs 29,000 crore via block deals, stepping up as promoters and FIIs offloaded large stakes across blue-chip names.

items.title: IndiGo promoter Interglobe Enterprises may sell up to 4% stake via block deals: CNBC-TV18
items.description: IndiGo block deal: Interglobe Enterprises owned 35.71 percent stake in InterGlobe Aviation, the parent company of IndiGo, as of March 2025.

items.title: Adani Ports, other Adani stocks plunge up to 3%: Here are 4 reasons behind the downturn
items.description: Adani stocks: 11 out of 12 stocks were trading in the red, with Adani Power being the only exception.

items.title: Quick Take: Geopolitical tensions to keep risk premium elevated
items.description: Markets worldwide are reeling under what analysts are calling "Black Friday" - the financial turmoil triggered by Israel's attack on Iran. While equity markets tumble, oil and gold prices surge as investors brace for a new phase of global uncertainty.

items.title: Air India plane crash impact: Boeing, GE Aerospace stocks extend losses, down up to 2% in pre-market
items.description: While the exact cause of the crash is not known yet, several analysts have pointed out that the possibility of GE Aerospace's engine failure being the cause may have sent the stock for a spin.

items.title: A dedicated portal for FPIs in works, SEBI in talks with exchanges and depositories
items.description: The portal will inform the FPIs what laws are applicable on them and how the compliance is to be done. Not only SEBI and RBI regulations, but FEMA, PMLA and other regulations are also applicable on FPIs. For PAN generation, Income Tax department is also involved.

items.title: Sensex plunges 700 pts, Nifty below 24,700 amid Middle East tensions; bank, auto, energy stocks drag
items.description: Broader markets, too, remained under pressure, with the Nifty Midcap 100 slipping 0.46 percent and the Smallcap 100 easing 0.45 percent.

items.title: 360 ONE WAM Shares Rise by Over 2% in Today's Trading Session
items.description: Currently, 360 ONE WAM is trading at Rs 1,103.65, reflecting a 2.06% increase in today's session.

items.title: Dr. Reddy's Laboratories Shares Decline Amid High Trading Volume
items.description: With the current price at Rs 1,358.50, Dr Reddys Laboratories is experiencing notable trading activity and remains an important component of the NIFTY 50 and NIFTY 100 indices.

items.title: Middle East conflict lifts shipping stocks; SCI, GE Shipping shares rise up to 10%
items.description: Indian shipping stocks surged up to 10% on June 13, defying a weak market, as rising Middle East tensions and fears of trade disruption through the Strait of Hormuz fueled concerns of rising tanker rates

items.title: Bharti Airtel Shares Trade With Moderate Losses in Today's Session
items.description: With the stock's current price at Rs 1,838.20, Bharti Airtel's financial metrics suggest a growing enterprise, despite the intraday dip.
